questions.question:
consider the following relational schema.
students(rollno:integer,sname:string)
courses(courseno:integer,cname:string)
registration(rollno:integer,courseno:integer,percent:real)
Which of the following queires are equivalent to this query in english?
Find the distinct names of all students who score more than 90% in the course numbered 107
Given the basic ER and relational models,which of the following is incorrect?
questions.optionA: An attribute of an entity can have more than one value
questions.optionB: An attribute of an entity can be composite
questions.optionC: In a row of a relational table , an attribute can have more than one value
questions.optionD: In a row of a relational table , an attribute can have exactly one value or a null value

questions.question: Suppose (A,B) and (C,D) are two relation schemas.Let r1 and r2 be the corresponding instances.B is a foreign key that refers to C in r2.If data in r1 and r2 satisfy referential integrity constraints,which of the following is always true?

Consider the following relations A, B, C. How many tuples does the result of the following relational algebra expression contain? Assume that the schema of A U B is the same as that of A.
TABLE A
IDNAMEAGE
12arun60
15shreya24
99rohit11

TABLE B
IDNAMEAGE
15shreya24
25hari40
98rohit20
99rohit11

TABLE C
IDPHONEAREA
1020001
99210001

Consider a relational table r with sufficient number of records, having attributes A1, A2,..An, An and let 1 <= p <= n. Two queries Q1 and Q2 are given below.
The database can be configured to do ordered indexing on Ap or hashing on Ap. Which of the following statements is TRUE?
questions.optionA: Ordered indexing will always outperform hashing for both queries
questions.optionB: Hashing will always outperform ordered indexing for both queries
questions.optionC: Hashing will outperform ordered indexing on Q1, but not on Q2
questions.optionD: Hashing will outperform ordered indexing on Q2, but not on Q1.
